newsitem.title: UK: Late LME copper recovers in light trade.
newsitem.headline: Late LME copper recovers in light trade.

text.p: Copper found enough buyers to get it off lows in late trading on Tuesday.
By 1900 GMT three months delivery was at $2,222 per tonne, up from its LME kerb close of $2,212.
It had moved down towards $2,200, amid fund liquidation on stops, traders said. But lower prices brought in enough buyers to create a bounce.
"A few brokers were short," one trader said. "Prices bounced on commission house selling," was another's verdict.
Traders described the volume of trade as low. "It's been very quiet," one said of trading after the kerb close.
Aluminium climbed back to $1,551.50 by 1900 GMT, compared with a kerb close of $1,547.
